intro: Aiouea hartmanii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Aiouea hartmanii plays an important role in the ecological systems of Hawaii, providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
